Declaring a column-split based on levels of a variable

Source: R/colby_constructors.R
add_colby_varlevels.Rd

Will generate children for each subset of a categorical variable

add_colby_varlevels(lyt, var, lbl = var, valuelblvar = var,
  splfmt = NULL, newtoplev = FALSE)

Arguments

lyt

layout object pre-data used for tabulation
var

string, variable name
lbl

string, label, often variable label
valuelblvar

string, name of variable containing split value display lables
splfmt

format spec. Format associated with this split.
newtoplev

boolean, Add this as a new top-level split (defining a new subtable directly under root). Defaults to FALSE

Examples


library(magrittr)

l <- NULL %>% add_colby_varlevels("ARM")
l
#> A Pre-data Table Layout
#> 
#> Column-Split Structure:
#> ARM (lvls) 
#> 
#> Row-Split Structure:
#> ( () ->  () -> ) () 
#> 

# add an analysis (summary)
l2 <- l %>%
    add_analyzed_vars("AGE", afun = lstwrap(summary) , fmt = "xx.xx")
l2
#> A Pre-data Table Layout
#> 
#> Column-Split Structure:
#> ARM (lvls) 
#> 
#> Row-Split Structure:
#> AGE (** analysis **) 
#> 

build_table(l2, DM)
#>             B: Placebo   C: Combination   A: Drug X
#> ---------------------------------------------------
#> AGE                                                
#>   Min.          21             22            20    
#>   1st Qu.       29             30            29    
#>   Median        32             33            33    
#>   Mean        33.02          34.57          34.91  
#>   3rd Qu.       37             38            39    
#>   Max.          55             53            60    

# By default sequentially adding layouts results in nesting
l3 <- NULL %>% add_colby_varlevels("ARM") %>%
  add_colby_varlevels("SEX") %>%
  add_analyzed_vars("AGE", afun = lstwrap(summary), fmt = "xx.xx")
l3
#> A Pre-data Table Layout
#> 
#> Column-Split Structure:
#> ARM (lvls) -> SEX (lvls) 
#> 
#> Row-Split Structure:
#> AGE (** analysis **) 
#> 

build_table(l3, DM)
#>              B: Placebo      C: Combination       A: Drug X  
#>               M       F        M         F        M       F  
#> -------------------------------------------------------------
#> AGE                                                          
#>   Min.       21      21       25        22       24      20  
#>   1st Qu.    28      29       29        30       31      29  
#>   Median     31      33       32        35       35      32  
#>   Mean      32.1    33.84    34.28     34.89    36.55   33.71
#>   3rd Qu.   35.75    38       38        39      41.5     38  
#>   Max.       47      55       53        53       60      58
